name: Sankoré Madrasah
description: An ancient center of learning and one of the oldest universities in the world.

name: Timbuktu Market
description: Bustling with local traders, spices, textiles, and traditional Malian crafts.

name: Tomb of Askia
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site and a brilliant example of Sudano-Sahelian architecture.

name: Desert Festival
description: An annual music and cultural festival that celebrates Tuareg traditions and global music.

name: Djinguereber Mosque
description: Built in 1327, this mosque is a symbol of Malian Islamic architecture.

name: Timbuktu Museum
description: Displays manuscripts, maps, and relics from Mali’s scholarly past.

name: Camel Safari
description: Experience the Sahara on a guided camel trek through the dunes.

name: Manuscripts Library
description: Preserves thousands of ancient manuscripts dating back centuries.
